snippet: The Obama administration began a full-press campaign for Congressional approval of its plan to carry out a punitive strike against the Syrian government.
abstract: Obama administration begins full-press campaign for Congressional approval of its plan to carry out punitive strike against Syrian government; holds its first classified briefing on Syria open to all lawmakers while Sec of State John Kerry appears on morning talk shows; Kerry reaches out to Arab diplomats to rally international support for firm response to chemical weapons attack in Damascus.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and JACKIE CALMES
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, and Steven Erlanger from London.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration began a full-press campaign for Congressional approval of its plan to carry out a punitive strike against the Syrian government.

headline.main: President Seeks to Rally Support for Syria Strike
headline.print_headline: President Seeks To Rally Support For Syria Strike
